description: An event corresponding to an incoming request or similar task occurring in a monitored service

id.description: Hex encoded 64 random bits ID of the transaction.

tid.description: Hex encoded 128 random bits ID of the correlated trace.

pid.description: Hex encoded 64 random bits ID of the parent transaction or span. Only root transactions of a trace do not have a parent_id, otherwise it needs to be set.

t.description: Keyword of specific relevance in the service's domain (eg: 'request', 'backgroundjob', etc)

n.description: Generic designation of a transaction in the scope of a single service (eg: 'GET /users/:id')

sd.description: Number of correlated spans that are recorded.

dd.description: Number of spans that have been dd by the a recording the x.

d.description: How long the transaction took to complete, in ms with 3 decimal points

rt.description: The result of the transaction. For HTTP-related transactions, this should be the status code formatted like 'HTTP 2xx'.

k.description: A mark captures the timing of a significant event during the lifetime of a transaction. Marks are organized into groups and can be set by the user or the agent.

sm.description: Transactions that are 'sampled' will include all available information. Transactions that are not sampled will not have 'spans' or 'context'. Defaults to true.
